title: During refueling or defueling, precautions have to be observ…
caption_en: During refueling or defueling, precautions have to be observed to minimise the risk of sparking due to static electricity. Instructions for Fueling and Defueling are found in the Learjet 45 Fueling Instructions Manual kept on board the aircraft pr A a ml sm aa ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: The fuel bowser and the aircraft must be properly bonded to …
caption_en: The fuel bowser and the aircraft must be properly bonded to ground. The fuel hose from the bowser must also be bonded to the aircraft. A more detailed explanation is provided in the module, GROUND HANDLING. po IN am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: The aircraft may be refueled by gravity or under pressure. p…
caption_en: The aircraft may be refueled by gravity or under pressure. po A a ml sm am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: For gravity filling, a Gravity Fill access panel is located …
caption_en: For gravity filling, a Gravity Fill access panel is located on the top of the fuselage, right hand side. A filler cap, which is accessible when the panel is opened, connects to the fuselage fuel tank. Fuel from the refueling source enters the fuselage tank and will automatically transfer to the wing tanks by gravity. Neither the engines nor the A-P-U should be running during gravity filling. prone IN am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: The amount of fuel may be checked by opening the refueldefue…
caption_en: The amount of fuel may be checked by opening the refueldefuel panel on the right side of the fuselage. The quantity indicator will be powered when the power switch is selected to ON and will show the total fuel uplifted. iar A a ml sm am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: The pressure refueling method is referred to as or Single Po…
caption_en: The pressure refueling method is referred to as or Single Point Pressure Refueling. it uses a different adaptor located at the Refueling panel and the bowser fuel nozzle is connected to this adaptor. po A a ml sm am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: Prior to refueling, rotate the Precheck Valve lever to the P…
caption_en: Prior to refueling, rotate the Precheck Valve lever to the PRECHECK OPEN position. When refueling starts, the incoming fuel pressure will cause the Refueling Shutoff Valve to open. At the same time the open Precheck valve will allow fuel to flow to the Pilot Valve. The Pilot valve should cause the Refueling Shutoff vaive to close within twenty seconds and stop the refueling. This is to confirm that the Pilot vaive will be able to automatically stop the refueling when the fuselage tank is full. JE IN am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: Once Pilot valve operation is confirmed, the Precheck valve …
caption_en: Once Pilot valve operation is confirmed, the Precheck valve lever is returned to the PRECHECK CLOSED position and refueling restarted. As fuel enters the fuselage tank; it will automatically flow into the wing tanks by gravity. When the fuselage tank is full, the Pilot valve will automatically close the Refueling Shutoff valve and terminate refueling. pone A a ml sm am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: During pressure refueling the engines should not be running.…
caption_en: During pressure refueling the engines should not be running. Refueling is allowed if the A-P-U is already running prior to refueling. If the A-P-U is not running when refueling starts, it should not be started until the refueling process is terminated. pone A a ml sm am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: Defueling is carried out by applying suction from the fuel b…
caption_en: Defueling is carried out by applying suction from the fuel bowser. The fuel nozzle from the bowser is connected to the refueling adaptor. At the RefuelDefuel panel, select the power switch to ON. Ge A a ml sm am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: The READY switch is then selected to the READY position. Thi…
caption_en: The READY switch is then selected to the READY position. This action opens the Crossflow Valve and the Defuel Valve. When both valves are full open the amber READY light illuminates. en IN am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: Defueling can then commence. Fuel from the left wing tank is…
caption_en: Defueling can then commence. Fuel from the left wing tank is sucked thru the left Standby pump inlet, thru the crossflow valve, the Defuel valve, into the Refueling adaptor. Fuel from the right wing tank is sucked thru the right Standby pump inlet, the Defuel valve and into the Refueling adaptor. Ge IN am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: When defueling is completed, the READY switch is selected to…
caption_en: When defueling is completed, the READY switch is selected to OFF. This signals the Crossflow and Defuel valves to close. When both valves are closed the green OFF light will illuminate. Ge IN am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: Return the Power switch to OFF and close the panel cover. No…
caption_en: Return the Power switch to OFF and close the panel cover. Note that the panel cover cannot close unless both switches are in the OFF position. LG wn IN am ee sm gm dm Wa wri

title: There will aiso be amber FUEL CROSSFLOW andor DEFUEL OPEN me…
caption_en: There will aiso be amber FUEL CROSSFLOW andor DEFUEL OPEN messages on CAS. erm A a ml sm am ee sm gm dm Wa wri
